title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX — In an era defined by high-flying offenses, a defensive war of attrition inside the Arena provided the stage for one of the most stunning individual performances in NBA history.

The final score, a 88-86 victory for the Dallas Mavericks over the Phoenix Suns, tells a story of a gritty, low-scoring affair. But the stat line of one man tells a story for the ages: Mavericks guard George McCloud.

On a night where both teams struggled to find any offensive rhythm, McCloud was a one-man hurricane. He erupted for a game-high 47 points, single-handedly outscoring the entire Phoenix starting lineup. While his teammates combined for just 41 points, McCloud was an unstoppable force, carrying the Mavericks on his back and dragging them across the finish line.

The Suns, led by Kevin Johnson’s 20 points and a strong 19-point, 15-rebound double-double from Hot Rod Williams, fought valiantly. They held the rest of the Mavericks in check, but they had no answer for the McCloud onslaught. Every time Phoenix threatened to seize momentum, McCloud had a response, his scoring barrage silencing the home crowd.

In the end, his historic 47-point night was the entirety of the Mavericks’ offense. It was a performance of sheer will, a player so dominant he didn’t just win the game; he *was* the game. On this night, George McCloud didn't just beat the Phoenix Suns; he transcended the sport itself.
